question: Sarah is organizing racks for the trade fair. Multiply the given numbers by arranging them in the blank boxes.(12 × 2)
Sarah arranges scarves on shelves. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many scarves will be displayed.(21 × 7)
Her team helps her to arrange dresses on racks. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many dresses will be displayed.(22 × 3)
Next she hangs coats on hangers. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many coats will be displayed.(31 × 8)
Sarah packs shirts into boxes. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many shirts will be packed.(52 × 4)
Sarah displays outfits on mannequins. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many outfits will be displayed.(50 × 5)
She prepares gift bags for visitors. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many gifts will be needed.(91 × 9)
They arrange skirts on racks. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many skirts will be displayed.(82 × 2)
Sarah arranges belts in rows. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many belts will be displayed.(90 × 3)
Sarah arranges handbags on racks. Multiply the given numbers in the blank boxes to find how many handbags will be displayed.(61 × 7)
